Key Match Events: Iran scored the first goal in the 24th minute with Mehdi Ghayedi sliding a shot past Hong Kong's goalkeeper Yapp Hung-fai.
Hong Kong had several missed chances, including by Philip Chan and Shahriyar Moghanloo.
The referee ended the first half after an unexpected even match.
Hong Kong coach Jorn Andersen made attacking substitutions, but the score remained 1-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Iran was expected to dominate due to their higher world ranking.
Hong Kong, playing in their first Asian Cup in over 55 years, had early chances.
Post-Match Reflections: Hong Kong coach Jorn Andersen expressed frustration at the missed opportunities.
Iran progressed to the knockout rounds despite a lackluster performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Khalifa International Stadium in front of 36,412 fans.
